website_summaries.verdict: An ideal keyboard for those looking for quiet, low profile keys that will still keep up with gaming or quick typing.
pros: The DeathStalker features slim chiclet keycaps and a built-in wrist rest
Keeps up with all keystrokes and is comfortable to use
Features a green backlight to easily see each key
cons: The larger keys are fragile and can break if removing for cleaning

customer_reviews.title: but it's a very nice keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this keyboard. This first one I ruined by spilling drinks on it (multiple times, oops.). The keyboard doesn't have excessive features, but it's a very nice keyboard for the price. No quirks, good build quality. I find it a nice keyboard for gaming. It isn't too small, my hands are large, and I have no problem quickly typing, or using multiple hotkey bindings for games. Update: Honestly, I wouldn't want to use any other keyboard at this point. I think they found the perfect button height, keypress firmness, keypress pressure, etc. Everything about this keyboard is made for efficiency, and it really shows once you get used to it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J.T

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTS HUMMMM so loud I have to turn them off or unplug my keyboard to sleep
customer_reviews.text: It sounds like a really loud electronic mosquito deep in your ear canal. I ultimately had to turn the lights off for most of my use because the constant hum gave me a headache and felt damaging to my ears. Sometimes I turn the lights on again if I'm gaming at night with headphones to drown out the humming. In my view, this makes the entire lighting system absolutely garbage since it is unusable without pain. If it didn't hum, it would be pretty good. Also, the keys are a bit on the sticky side. Occasionally I have to double tap a key to get it to go down and register.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Razer DeathStalker Chroma for about two years and I'm having no problems. I like the feel of the keys and it looks good, it's slim not bulky at all. The colors look good and there's lots of options, only sad thing is you can't program individual key colors for the DeathStalker. I'm not a hardcore gamer and I only really play single player games aside from Ark so I can't testify for games that you'd use a lot of key bindings for but like I've said I've had it for a couple years and nothing is worn away and nothing sticks. 10/10 it's pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'll open with the only downside of this keyboard - it feels a little cheap which has me wonder about how long it's going to last. However, with that said, it's the most comfortable keyboard I've ever used, the keys are spaced exactly how I would have wanted them, and it provides pretty much everything a casual PC gamer like myself would need, while also giving more hardcore gamers a solid, affordable choice. Overall, I think this is a very good keyboard for the price and I'm very happy that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: +XL, +Low profile, +Perfect responsiveness, -keystroke "feels cheap"
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works as advertised. If you love low-profile keyboards (short keys) and want responsiveness: this is it! The lighting (of the expert, monochromatic) of the keyboard is ideal. The size is surely XL, it takes a lot of space, but its slim design balances it out. The only drawback is that the keystroke "feels cheap", although there is nothing cheap about the quality of the DeathStalker. Yet, is really with the price! The feeling of cheap might be due to the kind of material used for the keystroke, but it seems to also be of good quality. So, if you are purchasing it, expect to have responsiveness, low profile keys, a flat yet large keyboard that looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Useful for any trade, gaming or otherwise
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for writing, gaming and editing and have never been bothered by any lack of function. The back light has a nice range of brightness and none of the indicator lights are too bright, even in the dark. One thing to keep in mind: I have a Razer Blade Pro, which is made with an aluminum case and keyboard. I expected this to also be made of aluminum, but it's actually plastic construction. This isn't a problem for me and doesn't hinder any usefulness or ergonomics, but I just didn't expect it. Perhaps it says that somewhere and I just missed it.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Brodovitch

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST KEYBOARD EVEN USING FOR 7+ YEARS
customer_reviews.text: I GOT THIS KEYBOARD 7 YEARS AGO WITH MY MOM AT A WALMART AND I'VE BEEN USING IT EVER SINCE, I'VE TRIED TO REPLACE IT WITH NEWER COOL KEYBOARDS LIKE CHERRY MX BROWN SWITCHES AND STUFF AND BLACKWIDOWS BUT THEY JUST WEREN'T THE SAME. NOW I HAVE A NEW ONE THAT FEELS EVEN BETTER THAN THE OLD ONE THE KEYS FEEL SO MUCH BETTER AND WAY MORE SATISFYING TO PRESS, AND IF YOU WERE WONDERING NO THE CAPS LOCK BUTTON ISN'T BROKEN I'M JUST SO DAMN HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISEMENT, DON'T BE TRICKED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really, it's a decent keyboard. But it's no different from my laptop keyboard other than the fancy lights. And even then the lights aren't as advertised. The DeathStalker Chroma videos here on Amazon show it going along with the Audio Visualizer, which I thought was so cool. Turns out the keyboard is divided into sections instead of having the individual lights that it's more expensive version (the BlackWidow) has. Really it's false advertisement. They posted a video about a completely different keyboard on Amazon when in actuality it's not nearly as cool, in fact it's a really lame boring keyboard. 2 stars for false advertising. It got my hopes up and disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Carebear

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my fiance for his birthday. I bought this from amazon used. I was very skeptical buying a used keyboard but it was totally worth the price. He has the matching mouse to go along with this product. It has many features which allow you to program the keyboard to different colors and they can even slowly change colors or stay a steady color. The bonus is if you have the mouse you can have the mouse and keyboard synchronize together! I would recommend this keyboard to anyone who is thinking about it. The fiance loves it so much better than his old keyboard! Great for the gamer in you!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse you can use for multi-purpose
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the best multipurpose keyboard. I will just go briefly Razer DeathStaleker (Membrane keyboard, Pentagraph) Pros - Thin and light (keyboard itself, and the buttons) - quiet - Razer synapse 2.0 program available - good for both gaming and typing (unlike red mechanical) - 10 anti-ghosting (key rollover) Cons - a bit overpriced (just like all the other razer products) - only one LED color available - it can be personal. but keyboard feels too plain (even for membrane, maybe its too plain to call it a gaming keyboard) It is good for someone who want a slim, quiet multi-purpose keyboard
customer_reviews.author: HML

customer_reviews.title: Been using it and I can say that I enjoy the look and feel
customer_reviews.text: Been using it and I can say that I enjoy the look and feel. The only thing I will say is that my gaming enthusiast friends have gotten me riding on the mechanical keyboard train, but I will say this. If you like the design, green LED lights, reduce sound impact where you're typing get this. This feels like an all purpose keyboard that can be used in the office or with sound sensitive roommates. I think a great pro for this keyboard is the extended width that lets your wrists rest elevated, better than most keyboards out there. I am definitely an avid keyboard user and probably already put 500+ hours on this sucker.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Chiu

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard has really got some nice comments from my friends and co workers alike
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has really got some nice comments from my friends and co workers alike. its quite and easy to use and change the colors easy, not like the other bigger keyboard that has customization keys. i.e. any key can be any color; no this one doesn't have that option but it this keyboard is still running great no issues and updates are easy and quick. no issues for pc usage for everything daily life here. I'm an web master and programmer. connection is by usb only. the driver user interface is easy to use and program for color changing not complicated like some others could be.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Jeter

customer_reviews.title: Try before buy. You may like it.
customer_reviews.text: For the price of the keyboard, I really liked the build of it as well as typing experience it can give you. The biggest positive is that slim profile and "chicletness" of the keyboard. Personally, the biggest downside was that the keys are relatively firm when compared to most chiclet style keyboards that you will come across. (I have used the hp elite v2 as well as the apple keyboard and this one is a bit more stiffer). I would recommend trying before buying if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as nice as the Anansi keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as nice as the Anansi keyboard, but for a fraction of the price it's more than reasonable. I'm not a huge fan of the lower profile keys as I like a satisfying click and feel when I type, but that's more a personal preference than anything else. Didn't quite sit "right" for me, either, but again... personal preference. I'm sure this keyboard is perfect for someone else and the quality seems up to what I would expect from Razer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Spacebar malfunctioning after 4 months use.  Sad.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard for my Minecraft PvP fanatical son back in January 2015. It's now May 21, 2015 and the spacebar on the keyboard has begun malfunctioning. If not for this, would be 5 stars for this product. My kiddo plays a lot so this is under expected heavy use--- but it's an Expert GAMING Keyboard, right? I expect something a product labled as such should demonstrate durability under substantial use. Outside of this, my son couldn't be happier with the keyboard--- loves the feel of the keys and the color scheme compliments his other Razer devices. Unfortunately have to send it back to Razer for a repair/replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I love my Razer DeathAdder mouse so I decided to try this keyboard (Chroma). Space bar started tilting to one side after 8 months which is very annoying. I tried popping it off to fix it but one of the plastic holders was broken which is very annoying. The keys are low which sounds good in theory but I have had a hard time avoiding pressing multiple keys at the same time so it's not a good keyboard for me to use for gaming. Otherwise the colors are great and the keys are pretty quiet when pressed.
customer_reviews.author: MsX

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and extremely disappointed in the longevity these ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this a year, and there is a "dead key" despite never having any water damage for the time I've had it. Still under warranty, but difficult to contact the manufacturer to obtain a return number to try to solve the problem. Likely will not buy a Razer keyboard in the future. Waste of money and extremely disappointed in the longevity these appear to have along with the lack of customer service for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: Great looking keyboard; annoying issue with lighting
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great looking keyboard. I like the chicklet keys. I have a tendency to drag my fingers across on normal keyboards, resulting in accidental presses. This avoids that. Cons: No macros. I also have this issue where every time I power down the PC and start it back up (note, that this doesn't happen on a restart), the RGB lighting won't start up. I have to reach in the back of the PC then unplug and replug in the keyboard. It'll still respond, but I bought the keyboard because of the lighting.
customer_reviews.author: NReese

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Substitute for a Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is perfect for people who need a reliable keyboard but aren't ready to make the leap to mechanical keyboards. Smooth, virtually silent, typing without any ghosting. As with all Chroma products, the lights are entirely customizable and come with set options, and will also sync with any other chroma products you have (i.e. lights on keyboard will sync with mouse, etc.). I am more than happy with this keyboard and I hope it lasts me a good long while.
customer_reviews.author: Aja J.

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to love this keyboard, but I just couldn't. Since I use my laptop so much, I thought I could work with the chiclet keys. However, I felt that my fingers just weren't getting used to the huge difference in style during gameplay. I have a Razer BlackWidow Chroma, and while it is more expensive, I will definitely be sticking with it. The lighting is much, MUCH better (I can't figure out why the DeathStalker has so many less options in lighting), and although mechanical is louder, I like the clicky keys and they feel more comfortable for me. I wanted to have a quieter keyboard for possibly streaming, but the DeathStalker just wasn't it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H

customer_reviews.title: Looks can be deceiving
customer_reviews.text: I first eyed this keyboard about a year ago, I was mesmerized by the abilitys of chroma. I decided to buy the keyboard in December I was so excited when it arrived. It looks sleek and was big and had so many options to customize it but recently this keyboard has been a pain. The space bar equalizer bar broke which I saw was a common problem in Razer keyboards. Another frustrating thing is that some of the keys are harder to push in then others. I Really wish it held up for longer then 4 months but now I truly see that Razer products are not build for durability but only for aesthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Saul

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic keyboard, as someone who was deciding on the chroma tournament keyboard and saw this one I knew this was a better choice. Pros: • The light sequences are so unique and you can choose to cycle through the color spectrum,wave between colors, pulse, or choose any color for the entire keyboard. • The keys are great no need to press to hard and I rarely have any trouble typing. Cons: If you have another Chroma Razer product Mouse Headset etc. you may have an issue with sync colors and will have to relaunch the program each time you start your computer. Overall I give this a 9.5/10
customer_reviews.author: Rae Y

customer_reviews.title: Best LED non mech keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I will start off by saying this has the best LED lights of any keyboard I have seen to date. They are bright and crisp lights and make the keyboard very beautiful. It pairs nicely with any other chroma mouse that Razer has to offer. My only complaint is that the keys seem to un-register themselves if you make a slight finger adjustment. It makes playing mmorpg's or any game where you are holding a key down to move sort of a pain. It seems to wear the muscles on your fingers much quicker than a mechanical keyboard. Now of you are using this keyboard for other games and/or typing papers or whatever, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: unreliable keys, less than 5 nkro.
customer_reviews.text: The Good: short key travel makes fast presses. The bad: For some reason the "C" key on mine required smashing to activate, and reading other reviews confirms this problem, that the key-pressing is unreliable. The keys themselves are not contrasted from the letters on them, but i touch type and for gaming it's not an issue for me. The worst part was despite being a semi-nkro, it failed past 3-5 keys... ex: i could hold w a and left shift (and space) but not num 0 past 3 keys being pressed; so how am I supposed to drop bombs in Battlefield with this keyboard, the reason I needed an nkro in the first place?
customer_reviews.author: Chuckles

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Really good keyboard Gros - light and easy to move from place to place (as I travel a lot and bring it with). - pretty durable so far after a year - good price for what you get Cons - doesn't light up. I know this sounds stupid sometimes but when playing in the dark I sometimes lose where my keys are because you can't see them at all in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Logue

customer_reviews.title: but they are pretty hard to find
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the chiclet style keyboards, but they are pretty hard to find. This one is exactly what I needed. The keys are great, and its very quiet, and the built in wrist rest makes it very comfortable to use. I do feel that the price is a little high for a keyboard with no backlit keys, but I knew that before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Heckman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Razer Customer
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a mechanical razer keyboard in the past and loved, but i wanted something a little more low key for work in the office. I was looking for the chiclet style keys, because they are similar to my macbook, but these keys feel loose and spongy. Not worth the ~$45 in my opinion, when you could get a logitech, dell, or something less expensive for the same or better quality. The only pro i can give the keyboard is that its frame is very sturdy, i have a weird gap in my desk that i rest the keyboard over and there is no flex in the frame whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Hoherchak

customer_reviews.title: eh. broken out the gate 2 times in a row. Still a decent keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is beautiful and super comfy to type on, but when I got it, a few keys weren't working. They were just the arrow keys, so it wasn't a big deal. I didn't notice until after the return time was up, so i bought another. It had similar issues. I wouldn't recommend it unless you REALLY want an RGB chiclet keyboard. I wanted one, so i got it. I also found out that unlike other RGB keyboards by companies like Razer, you cannot change the color per-key. I should have done more research before buying, i admit. I enjoy the keyboard, but I would invest in a mechanical keyboard instead, looking back.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett LeFever

customer_reviews.title: Responsive, Quiet and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a very comfortable grip and streamlined height of the keys. It has a very responsive touch to the key strokes. The built in wrist guard is a nice touch as well. The software hooked up easily to a preexisting account and the computer easily recognized the new hardware. It is very quiet with the keystrokes! If I were to have to buy another keyboard any time soon, this would certainly be the one I picked.
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is harder than I would have like to press down
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my aging keyboards, and I do game. This keyboard is harder than I would have like to press down, as compared to my yoga keyboard. It also doesn't come with enough LED sections to support the effect where light spreads out from the key you press. That said, it is a nice keyboard, and the lights make it look amazing. Had some problems connecting it to different computers though, as it would turn on and then just died out on that computer. Could use some edits for the 90$ it's asking.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment. Also this not a scissor switch keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The "z" key stopped working suddenly. I reinstalled the drivers, rebooted, still nothing. I have to copy and paste z just to use it in this comment. What a disappointment. Also this not a scissor switch keyboard. It's rubber dome.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Samuel

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I stayed away from razer due to quality issues but at the time this was the only RGB style keyboard with this type of keys. I have used this for a while and love it would repurchase. The wrist rest area also makes it very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: C.H.B.

customer_reviews.title: All other keys are fine except the darn "K"
customer_reviews.text: A few months into it the "k" stopped working. It is weird. All other keys are fine except the darn "K". Looked through every thing couldn't figure out why. Finally sent email to their tech support, which I had to google to find out. They did email back with some "fix", seems like some kind of software issue. My eyes are crossed trying to follow their instructions, haven't fixed it yet. For the price I paid for this thing it should last longer. It is annoying beyond words. Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.author: Mom in big D

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable keyboard with the large integrated wrist pad
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable keyboard with the large integrated wrist pad. The build is sturdy despite being plastic. The only complaint is that the labels on the keys are light grey and don't stand out too well from the dark grey color of the keyboard. This normally won't be a problem for the backlit models, but for the "Essential" model, the keys can be difficult to discern. I had to return it--an otherwise very good keyboard--simply for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: nob

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great keyboard for day to day use or for gaming. I really like the chiclet style keys and the extended palm wrest. The back-lighting helps for seeing the keys and the matte smooth texture overall resists the appearance of dirt and smudges. I have bought a similar (knockoff) keyboard and there is no mistaking the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Yarrow10

customer_reviews.title: This is actually a really good keyboard, it's just not the keyboard for me
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a really good keyboard, it's just not the keyboard for me. The response on it is perfect, programming is nice and even included an extra program that helped bring my surround sound headset to life. The downside is my hands sweat when I game and since the keys and the board are plastic on plastic molding it makes it a problem. After about a month I have to take the keys apart and clean it out to keep the keys from sticking to the sides as you press the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mason

customer_reviews.title: Normally prefer mechanical keyboards, but this one is everything I want in a keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have always preferred mechanical keyboards, but I noticed that the DeathStalker was a bit cheaper than Razer's mechanical keyboards, so I thought I'd give it a chance. And so far, I'm definitely satisfied. It may be a membrane keyboard, but it still has the elements that most gamers look for. A good feeling from the keys, decent tactile feedback for a non-mechanical keyboard, etc. The Chroma lighting effects are sharp looking, and easy to edit and customize with the software. For the price, you can't go wrong with this keyboard, and even mechanical keyboard fans won't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: Razer never fails to fail
customer_reviews.text: This will be the last Razer product I ever own. Every new razer item is constantly more garbage than the last. I had to purchase this keyboard because the last keyboard stopped working I returned it they gave me a store credit but the keyboard was out of stock and when it came back in stock my store credit for the keyboard ran out so I paid 100$ for a month of use. I regrettably bought another razer keyboard. Please don't be like me buy logitech, not some overpriced overadvertised brand that has no customer loyalty.
customer_reviews.author: mitch barnes

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've had
customer_reviews.text: I love the flatter (or chiclet) style of keys this keyboard has. Sadly, not many companies are making these kinds anymore, so I'm hoping that this one doesn't give out anytime soon. I hope that in the future they remake a model like this so I'm able to upgrade to that one.
customer_reviews.author: NoctisVia

customer_reviews.title: Second one i've purchased, this one is low quality....
customer_reviews.text: This is my second DeathStalker Expert keyboard. This one is particularly chintzy compared to my first one. Not only does it feel like a huge amount of plastic has been removed over the years, the keyboard does not even sit flat. Its as if the keyboard was warped during production, and it wont even sit flat on my desk. Even tried bending it in the opposite direction, and it wont even stay. Horrible to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: been using it for over 4 years
customer_reviews.text: i bought this back in 2015 and now it's late 2019 and the keyboard still works. my favorite part about it is the silent aspect, but also that it has a low profile. i tried buying a high end mechanical keyboard from logitech but found the key caps too far from each other, particularly from the wasd keys to the function keys above. this keyboard has the media control keys used right above the wasd keys. but im still looking to upgrade from this bad boy, as it isnt the most comfortable for long periods of typing or gaming.
customer_reviews.author: BathroomBuddha

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but types well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the "Razer DeathStalker Essential Gaming Keyboard" and i'm a little disappointed. I got it for work just to have a solid keyboard instead of a cheap stock dell one. Only issue is this keyboard feels just as cheap and has incredible keyboard flex. I will say it types really well and I like the bottom pad to rest my hand on. The keyboard seem very lopsided as well and moves back and forth. My desk could be part of the problem so I don't fully blame the keyboard for that. If the keyboard was a bit more solid I would of liked it a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Makes my marriage better. I work late at night and life in ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes my marriage better. I work late at night and life in a loft with my wife. Before this keyboard I used the Razer BlackWidow which is also awesome. However, the mechanical nature of the BlackWidow caused a significant noise issue as the sound travels well. My wife is as happy with this purchase as I am as she can no longer here the clicks. I do miss the mechanical keyboard's touch but this keyboard has actually improved my life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in 2012. It's just ok. After the year warranty was up the V key started sticking, so whenever I used it I'd see this on the screen "vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv." Razer is notorious for bad customer support, so I'm kinda glad that it happened after the warranty so that I wouldn't have to deal with them. It worked well for the year, so if you need something cheap to tide you over for a little while, you can get about a year out of this while you save up for something better. Right now it's a backup keyboard just in case my mechanical one fail.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard.. But...
customer_reviews.text: Best thing about this keyboard is the ability to assign a macro to any key. Ive had this keyboard for 9 months and use it daily for work and gaming. Maybe its something I did but the Y key no longer has the same tactile response as the other keys. Feels like it didn't press much and trigger a Y but it does. I always hit the left shift on the edge and its starting to bind as I press it down. For the price Id suggest spending a bit more and get a mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Durnil

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool, would make a solid gift.
customer_reviews.text: Not me, but the 13-yo loves it. If there are any grandparents or parents who want to stun their kid with insiders knowledge on the most bombastic keyboard out there - this is your ticket. The illuminated keyboard has me thinking there may be a need for this device in my office someday. Note that the keys are chicklet (yes, like the gum squares), so it's perhaps not a keyboard for a writer or code-composition purist.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzrob

customer_reviews.title: Overall, not impressive. Not worth the Razer logo that's printed on it.
customer_reviews.text: It's alright looking, but the key labels are really dark, making them all but impossible to make out if you don't already know where each key is. I also have to point out that as someone who types pretty fast (55 WPM)(I never thought this speed was ridiculously fast, I'm sure plenty type faster than me) this keyboard doesn't do a good job of keeping up with every keystroke like I expected. I've been through a couple keyboards because of the same issue, I have to go back and proofread everything I type because letters have been omitted or added in by the slow response time of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard, but backlight noise is a dealbreaker
customer_reviews.text: The DeathStalker Chroma is well-made, sturdy, and a pleasure to type on; however, it emanates a high-pitched whine when the backlight is on. I tried adjusting it using the Synapse software but the noise would not go away. Turning the backlight off completely stops the noise, which is not a solution. I'm not the only one who has experienced this noise issue, so I can only assume it's an engineering flaw, and that some users who are not sensitive to such noise do not notice.
customer_reviews.author: LuxuriousYurt

customer_reviews.title: can't see the letters.
customer_reviews.text: ok keyboard function wise. can't really see the letters because they are grey on black (show up much brighter on the pictures then they really are.) only had it a few days and the D key letter is fading off. can't imagine this being an actual gaming keyboard when the letters start fading in a few days.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bullard

customer_reviews.title: I really do love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really do love this keyboard. It's one of the best keyboards that I have used, and the chiclet style keys were actually really good. They're low profile so getting between keys is not a challenge at all. Your fingers glide across entire keyboard and it's really cool. They don't have macro keys on this keyboard so that is a little bit harder if you want to program your macro shortcuts. It'll still work with the cloud service so you can install the profiles that you have saved on the cloud into the keyboard, but I have yet to figure it out. Still worth buying, especially if your gamer budget.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Essentials Edition Not worth the $15 Savings!
customer_reviews.text: I foolishly purchased the essentials editions of this keyboard thinking that the keys would still be somewhat visible in a dimly lit room...I was wrong. Unless you are an expert typist and never need to glance at your keyboard to press keys like "print screen" or any of the F keys, you should definitely purchase the Expert edition which has backlit keys. I don't think it would have been too much to ask for them to at least put some ink on the letters to make them reflect a bit of light. Other than that, the keyboard works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great chicklet board
customer_reviews.text: If you like "laptoppy" chicklet-style keyboard, this one is it. Nice low and consistent key action. Choice of standard (cheap) or backlit (not cheap). Haven't messed with the macros. I greatly prefer this keyboard to a top-shelf mechanical I tried to get into.
customer_reviews.author: trailmug

customer_reviews.title: Really good gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After a year of usage, the keys still work like new and the backlight still works perfect. Really good keyboard if you want a low profile keyboard. The keys feel nice, and the overall build feels pretty nice for being made of plastic. The lights are pretty much the perfect brightness. Not blinding, but not too dim. The palm rest is the best part when typing.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton

customer_reviews.title: After few months keys started to stuck
customer_reviews.text: After few months of using keys started to stuck so I bought new one. Poor quality. (I was using 1-2 hour a day and kept keyboard clean but keys started to stuck so it became useless for gaming)
customer_reviews.author: Dachi

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! I'm so sad that it appears to be discontinued. I bought one for my girlfriend's computer, and now I'm considering buying one for myself even though I already have the same thing but without the color options. The colors on it are so cool and can be programmed in so many different unique ways. You can truly make this thing beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Junk Spent hours trying to get this stupid thing to work
customer_reviews.text: Junk Spent hours trying to get this stupid thing to work. It worked fine when I first plugged it in. Then a day later, intermittently worked. Tried driver updates so many times. Now as I type this on my phone keyboard, it no longer works at all. I'm on Windows 10...
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten the backlit version.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard looks and performs as expected. The keys are more 'squishy' than that last membrane keyboard I had but It performs as advertised. I wish I would have bought the illuminated version however because the key labeling is very low contrast so it makes key finding in the dark difficult.
customer_reviews.author: DirtyLaundry

customer_reviews.title: Form over function
customer_reviews.text: The palm rest at the bottom of the keyboard has an insert that provides no real benefit. It has a groove around it that collects dust and finger oil. I'd prefer the palm rest be the same plastic as the rest of the keyboard. Another annoying thing is the noise. I had an Illuminated Logitech keyboard with a similar rubber key switch and it was much quieter. If looks matter to you the cable is unbraided and does not match the Chroma Deathadder mouse which I also have.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great product, best keyboard of many I have tried. Room for improvment thouh.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, wish it came it more color options other than green. I don't have any need for a multi color keyboard would just like a blue one. Would love an option for a slightly larger spacing of the keys for someone with XLL hand sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H

customer_reviews.title: I'm very glad I chose to go with this membrane vs the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very glad I chose to go with this membrane vs the scissor switch keyboard. It is not completely quiet but my microphone doesn't pick it up as much as it would have were I to use anything else. The keyboard itself is solid enough that your key presses don't reverb weirdly against the desk, making that odd hollow echo. And of course, the lighting is epic. Highly customizable. Macro recording and shortcut binding is just godly. Don't think I'll be switching to anything else for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Chiclet style keys are great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard as a replacement to an old Saitek which still works but was getting pretty worn down. The main reason I went with this model was because of the chiclet style keys which are similar to keys you would find on a laptop. The keys are pretty much exactly what I expected of them. Not quite as good as the keys on my macbook pro but still good. Other then that everything works well. I had no compatibility issues. I also didn’t bother with the Synapse 2.0 software which I know many people do not like.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Sa

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy the plain version -- get the Chroma version!
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard but some dimwit thought dark grey on black was a reasonable color scheme for the keys. If you like this keyboard, buy the color version. Trust me -- even the best touch typist is eventually going to get annoyed by keys they can only see in bright light. If you're a gamer, its hopeless! Most gamers play in the dim light of their monitor. It is incredibly frustrating to be trying to learn a new game's keyboard layout when you can't read the keys!
customer_reviews.author: Adel Ang

customer_reviews.title: great buy for anyone
customer_reviews.text: So beautiful, and so responsive. I came from a gaming laptop keyboard to a desktop setup once again. The sleek chiclet keyface flows perfectly to the eye and the LED backlight option are a sight to behold everytime I sit down to use it.The feel is amazing and familiar, and noticably more responsive. I couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard...be prepared however; you can hear the LED's, if you're familiar with how EL wire sounds, that's this sound, a constant buzzzzzzzzzzz. Gets louder as the brightness is increased. Doesn't bother me, but be aware. Endlessly customizable colors. Wonderfully quiet chiclet keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AMT

customer_reviews.title: I have had worse keyboards that cost more
customer_reviews.text: I have had worse keyboards that cost more, much more. People have complained about the keys for actual typing and I don't have that complaint. I type every day, some times for 8 hours, and I really like the feel of the keys. When it comes to gaming it fast and responsive in all the ways that matter. The driver and setup program add a few touches, like dimming the lights on the keys, and macros. THe backlighting does not bleed out between the keys, nor is it distracting. Others have said they wish it wasn't green, but I find it is easier to see than other colors. Worth the money to me, and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T. Gordinier

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Keys are sensitive to the touch so you don't have to press hard for the keys to register. The keys make minimal noise when pressed. The green light stays a solid color and is a nice personal touch to the keyboard. Also, the wrist pad is great! My wrists don't hurt anymore from long hours of gaming!
customer_reviews.author: xSnowFox

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sleek Design!
customer_reviews.text: My parents didn't like my mechanical keyboard because of the clicky noise so I went ahead and got this keyboard and fix the problem! It's a well designed keyboard for those who don't like mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Slim keys perfect for gaming but the print is too dark
customer_reviews.text: I really love the feel of this keyboard. I purchased the standard version of it without the backlighting since I personally do not feel the need to customize the colors of my keyboard. The keys themselves are very nice and slim which is perfect for gaming. It is not loud when you type on it either and the wrist rest is a nice addition. I am satisfied with this keyboard. However, I only give it 4-stars because the print on the keys themselves is a bit too dim and dark. It's hard to see the letters on the keyboard even if you have a lot of lighting. Overall, very nice keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: D.V.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay....maybe I got a dud. Not worth the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are not all consistent with how much pressure is needed to push down. It's definitely not a tactile like I expected coming from Razer. A bit mushy, and again, some keys require more force than others to activate
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I love this keyboard, which I am using now. Lights up like my old Razer but thankfully i can customize the color using their app. There's a lot of functionality to this and the keys are low profile, which for me works great! Smooth typing. Responsive. Can't think of one bad thing to say. If you're not into low profile keys don't buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: LSweet

customer_reviews.title: DeathStalk The Night Away In Neon Pink
customer_reviews.text: The action is great. The lighting is fantastic. The "Razer Synapse" software allows for assigning certain color schemes to applications. My only critique is that the keyboard has been left out of the SDK, which allows for things like audio visualizations. If you want the full-on experience, you might want to go with the mechanical Black Widow Chroma. The "Stealth" model is available from Razer's website and their website only. If you're OK without the kitsch, pick this keyboard up. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostio

customer_reviews.title: Got what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: I own the razer balckwidow and i love it very much but i had two gripes with it: -It was very noisy - Fingers felt sore after extended use The razer deathstalker is a minimalist keyboard by all means it has no dedicated macro buttons or media keys (this is all done through a function key much like in laptops. Though as stated above i bought this keyboard loking for comfort and silence and on both accounts this keyboard is a success. Pros: -Easy on the fingers for extended use -Silent -Nice clear green led -wrist rest Cons -No auxiliary usb input -100% plastic Overall i am very satisfied with my purchase and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Goulart

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming keyboard but I have occasional key registry errors
customer_reviews.text: It's a comfortable keyboard and helped with some gaming aspects, in fact it's wonderful for gaming. However, while typing I constantly get keys double registering or double tapping while typing produces 3-4 letters. Occasionally get key errors in game as well with wasd where I have to completely release all keys to get a reset (i.e. constantly on wasd in an fps, proceed to hold s to run backwards while strafing side to side but get no s response). I use it for gaming and it's mostly great, but for typing anything it's almost unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Malczewski

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't handle multiple keystrokes if caps lock is included.
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get a new keyboard that was supposed to handle above average multiple keystrokes at a time. As a gamer I tend to use caps lock along with other keys, but this keyboard cannot utilize more than 2 when caps lock is part of the equation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for all users!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a really flat low profile keyboard, similar to a laptop keyboard. It doesn't lay as flat as my old one and took some getting used to, but there doesn't seem to be too many options for gaming keyboards with low profile keys. However, now that I'm used to it I can type just fine. The font on the keys is a little different, but that really doesn't effect the performance of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: loklok104

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, works as casual and gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Good keyboard, works as casual and gaming keyboard. The lighting on it is awesome for typing in the dark, the rest for your wrist is comfy. The one problem with it is that the texture of the keys kinda feels weird, and because of the texture they pick up fingerprints pretty easily and make the keys look dirty, when they actually aren't. If you're willing to clean it once per-week (like you should probably do with any nice keyboard) and like the flat keys, then this is an awesome keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kochheiser

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I really like quietness of the membrane keys vs the 'clickiness' of the mechanical keyboard. It makes for a great office keyboard where I don't necessarily want to announce to the world that "HEY! I'M TYPING NOW THOUGHT YOU MIGHT WANT TO KNOW". I like the color schemes and the actuation of the keys is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Mattei

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Keys are hard to see
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the deathstslker essentials one. I got it 2 days ago and am already returning it. It looks nothing like the pictures. The keys do not have the white tint on them and are very hard to see. The armrest is made of cheap plastic and doesn't look like what the picture shows. The keyboard in general is very cheaply made and seems like will break if I press a button too hard. I would much rather have an amazon basic keyboard than this as this is not worth the $40. The keyboard is a $10 cheap plastic with razed logo on it that makes it expensive. Definitely not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We know Razer is good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Works as it's suppose to and the packaging was both superb and stylish. I would give it 5 stars if the cable was braided, for the price it should be. I've used the keyboard before for both work and gaming as I like the response and general easy of typing. My keyboard isn't silent though as some have suggested, which wasn't a priority to me.
customer_reviews.author: D Porter

customer_reviews.title: MACBOOK COMPATIBLE :) + Awesome Software
customer_reviews.text: Much like typing on a Macbook Pro Keyboard the keys are slick and more like your standard laptop keyboard. The customizing of the lights is a great feature and adds personality to your gaming. The software worked very easily with MAC and you can custom the keys so they work just like on your mac and for STARCRAFT you can set up your macros very easily :)
customer_reviews.author: Kell (Tech Nerd)

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I've yet to really use a gaming keyboard that I am completely content with. I'm sure the newer version of this keyboard is significantly better, but I felt like going the cheaper route and went with this older model. The distinction between keys isn't what I would have hoped for and it is noisier than I would have liked. The subtle texture design at the bottom is slightly engraved into the keyboard, which can collect dust/crumbs very easily while making it a challenge to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is incredibly good looking. Everything looks and feels like it's very ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is incredibly good looking. Everything looks and feels like it's very high quality as well. I know some people say that keys will randomly stop working, or that when your computer sleeps you have to unplug and re plug in the keyboard, but I haven't had either of those problems. Overall, I can't see any flaws with this, if there was any improvement to be made to it, I'd say it'd be nice to be able to change the lighting color, but it isn't even a flaw for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I like green. I actually like the shortish travel distance ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels slightly overpriced for a chiclet keyboard, but.. Pros: Keys are lit green. I like green. I actually like the shortish travel distance for keystrokes. I use this for multiple genres (FPS, MMO, etc) and it's served all my needs admirably with no surprises. Also, I really like the smooth, yet slightly textured wrist-rest. Cons: Pricetag feels a little steep, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: tess

customer_reviews.title: Don't Skimp on Your Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended this keyboard by a user at PC Part Picker, while it looks good online, the fact that the keys are dark and not backlit actually make it much more difficult to use than I had thought. The keyboard is responsive and you are getting some nice value, but a couple months in, I'm already looking at replacing this keyboard for a higher end keyboard. Your keyboard is one of the major parts you interact with on your computer, and were I to do it again, I would have picked a different Razor model.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Kleinman

customer_reviews.title: Quiet soft keyboard with features
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboards features, especially for Overwatch! Built in features, custom options, COLORS, everything a gamer needs in their life, regrettably, it's so quiet and soft I feel like I get no response when I press the keys without really PRESSING them. Still not bad for gaming, but be weary, feedback can be meh.
customer_reviews.author: Kaydoo

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive but effective. The palm rest area is a bit large and could've been made smaller, or of a more comfortable material. The entire frame is made of hard plastic. The keys have a good feel and bounce so typing is comfortable and easy. Use it at the office for work. Razer software to sync settings is kind of useless for me, wish it had the option to easily deactivate CAPS lock and other useless keys like logitech software.
customer_reviews.author: JGtzTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: had a s***ty hp keyboard that came with my old desktop 5 years ago was using it for a while and was in need of a new keyboard and i have a razer mouse which works wonders so id figure id get a razer keyboard.. the keyboard its self is great love the green lighting and i love the wrist rest that extends the keyboard.. people said that the keyboard types loud but imo it doesnt.. my only wonders is how long will this keyboard last.. razer products dont last long so i hope i get at least 3-4 years off it
customer_reviews.author: marc dorvilias

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Just...wow!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is awesome. I can't use it myself (I gave it as a gift) because I need an ergo/split keyboard, but if Razer ever makes one? I'm buying it. Back-lit, awesome font, cool cable, intense packaging. It was FUN to open and set-up. It's not just a keyboard and, frankly, if you buy the other components like the mouse (I did) and the HUGE mouse-pad that matches it (again, I did), your desk will look so cool...assuming you like the DeathStalker green-and-black logo. That's all on you. But, yeah, great keyboard! Buy the set, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Threadgill

customer_reviews.title: I feel like it's a knock off product with razer stickers on ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had Deathstalker keyboards for years and this one feels cheap... the keys are unresponsive. I feel like it's a knock off product with razer stickers on it. 1 - Razer products always come with stickers ... this one did not.. I own several Razer items and you always get the sticker. 2 - my old one had a different hand rest surface and keys felt much smoother... these are textured and not comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! If you want a mechanical feel, do not buy this keyboard. If you want an excellent, but different feel with all the accuracy you get from a mechanical key, get this. `Nuf said, now go get your game on!
customer_reviews.author: break_fix

customer_reviews.title: I like the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard, I think that it has a great layout and the keys are very well positioned, I like the fact that it doesn't have macros keys, but, it is clunky to use, if I would have to buy it again, I would buy a mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Sandrea

customer_reviews.title: Not just for Gamers
customer_reviews.text: I do work in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator and use the macros to generate shortcuts. I find it more convenience then using my Wacom tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Good Sam

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard in combo with the 2014 Razer Naga and these 2 together are perfect for gaming. The *click* of the mechanical keys isn't any louder than a regular keyboard which people seem to complain about it being loud. The feet on the back could stand to have a taller setting but thats very minor as I dont use a desk very often anyway. The keyboard is also the perfect length for throwing in a normal size backpack and doesn't stick out at all. Overall- definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and extremely durable
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for a few years and still works like new although a bit dirtier. Used quite a few keyboards before I gave in and tried more name brand products and now would want to use nothing else. Eventually switched all my accessories over to razer and haven't been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Almquist

customer_reviews.title: So far its a great keyboard, the only reason I am giving it ...
customer_reviews.text: So far its a great keyboard, the only reason I am giving it 4 stars vs 5 is because compared to the mouse and pad the color is slightly different at the angle I sit, Ive tried toying with settings and tbh an arial shot of color matches perfectly but behind a desk its "lighter" than my chosen color of blood orange.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: CHICLET
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Razer products so I had high hopes for this keyboard. I am not a fan of mechanical keyboards and not a lot of big/well known brands offer quality chiclet keyboards. I love it; Razer is a great and reliable name and I would definitely recommend if you want to switch up to something amazing as the Deathstalker.
customer_reviews.author: RickBFP

customer_reviews.title: Great product I do not like the real clicky keyboards ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product I do not like the real clicky keyboards or raised keys. This is almost like a laptop and works great. The only mistake I made was ordering the one that doesn't light up. If I could go back I would get that one. It has great response time and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Scruffy

customer_reviews.title: razer gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: its not a bad keyboard, but I get the next level up. I went through a lot of key boards about 1 a month, I am very hard on them when i am gaming .Logitech is not a good keyboard for me, letters and numbers are flaying every were when I am playing a game. for years I was using Logitech the one that the keys light up corded or cordless just don`t now y they can`t make a better board, they have this little plastic piece holding the keys on its just not good enough for me I guess? but this razer can take it
customer_reviews.author: William R. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend finding an anti-ghosting gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is cheap and works. BUT it has ghosting meaning you can't hit more than 3 keys at the same time and have them to work. Meaning many games are now unplayable. Playing WoW moving forward and strafing and can't cast abilities. Highly recommend finding an anti-ghosting gaming keyboard. You'd be surprised how may times this keyboard will mess you up when playing games when you can't do 3 things at a time. (ctrl+alt+del and ctrl+shift+esc works, but w + a + 1, w + a + z, w + a + capslock, etc. does not)
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gaming keyboard. Poor as a typing keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: The DeathStalker's all-plastic design and lack of physical support underneath the middle of the keyboard means that it flexes noticeably when you type on it, regardless of whether or not you extend the keyboard's feet. I bought this keyboard for use as both a gaming keyboard and a work keyboard. It works great for gaming; having the ability to macro every key is really useful. Touch-typing on this thing, however, is a pain. I'm going to hot glue a shim onto the bottom of this thing to prevent it from bending when I type. :/
customer_reviews.author: Gamrin

product_meta.title: Razer DeathStalker Expert - Backlit Ergonomic Fully Programmable Membrane Black Gaming Keyboard - 10 Key Rollover
feature_bullets: Take your gaming into the dark with a fully backlit keyboard. Enabled with Razer Synapse 2.0, you can customize your gaming experience to your unique preferences
The Razer DeathStalker Expert features 10-key rollover, meaning no matter the complexity of your commands your keyboard will never get in between you and your game
The slim 2mm chiclet keycaps on the Razer DeathStalker ensure less time is needed to actuate each key so you can react faster to situations and enemies
With a built-in wrist rest, the DeathStalker's ergonomic design is optimized for maximum comfort no matter how long the gaming marathon lasts
Razer Synapse 2.0 is cutting-edge software that functions as the Razer DeathStalker’s brain, automatically syncing the gaming keyboard to a cloud server, while saving your individual settings

specifications.Operating System: Windows® 8/ Windows® 7 / Windows Vista® / Windows® XP
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,795 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
